intro: Rauhiella, commonly known as the rock cress, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Brassicaceae. These plants are typically small, herbaceous species that thrive in rocky or arid environments. They are characterized by their simple, alternate leaves and small, cruciform flowers. Rauhiella species are often found in mountainous regions and can be adapted to harsh, dry conditions. The genus includes several species, some of which are used in horticulture for their ornamental value.
